page.title: 01INTRO. GT. AYTON W. SECTION
page.content: This is an area of gently undulating, largely arable, farmland, about 80m. above sea level.There is a steep sided ridge to the N.E.,rising to 90m., called Langbaurgh Ridge,that has been deeply quarried for 'Whinstone' (basalt) then partly infilled with building and domestic rubbish. Though most of the area is enclosed cropland and pasture there are several woods, totalling about 1 sq. km.. Tanton and Tunstall are typical large farms that were once villages. A network of lanes links these to the Cleveland industrial area to the north. Half of Gt.Ayton 'village' (population about 5000 ) is in our area, on the River Leven with its trout and ducks. Housing ranges from the picturesque stone to functional modern brick.
